$a)$ First, we have to find out the actual value of equity which we denote with $AE$, where the shares $S$ is $\$7,500,000$ and the per-share sell $PS$ is $51$

$$\begin{align*}
AE&=S \times PS\\[7pt]
&=7,500,000 \times 51\\[7pt]
&=\$382,500,000
\end{align*}$$

So, the actual value of equity is $\boxed{\$382,500,000}$

We have to find out the actual value of the preferred stock which we denote with $AP$, where the shares $S$ is $\$250,000$ and the per-share sell $PS$ is $103$

$$\begin{align*}
AP&=S \times PS\\[7pt]
&=250,000 \times 103\\[7pt]
&=\$25,750,000
\end{align*}$$

So, the actual value of preferred stock is $\boxed{\$25,750,000}$

We have to find out the actual value of debt  which we denote with $AD$, where the bonds $B$ is $\$140,000$, par value $PV$ is $\$1,000$ and the selling rate $SR$ is $107\%$

$$\begin{align*}
AD&=B \times PV \times SR\\[7pt]
&=140,000 \times 1,000 \times 107\%\\[7pt]
&=140,000 \times 1,000 \times 1.07\\[7pt]
&=\$149,800,000
\end{align*}$$

So, the actual value of debt is $\boxed{\$149,800,000}$

We have to find out the total value of the firm which we denote with $TF$, where the actual value of equity $AE$ is $\$382,500,000$, the actual value of preferred stock $AP$ is $\$25,750,000$ and the actual value of debt $AD$ is $\$149,800,000$

$$\begin{align*}
TF&=AE + AP+AD\\[7pt]
&=382,500,000+25,750,000+149,800,000\\[7pt]
&=408,250,000+149,800,000\\[7pt]
&=\$558,050,000
\end{align*}$$

So, the total value of firm is $\boxed{\$558,050,000}$

Now, we have to find out the weight of debt which we denote with $WD$, where the  actual value of debt $AD$ is $\$149,800,000$ and the total value of firm $TF$ is $\$558,050,000$

$$\begin{align*}

WD &=\frac{AD}{TF}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{149,800,000}{558,050,000}\\[12pt]
&=0.2684
\end{align*}$$

Therefore, the weight of debt is $\boxed{0.2684}$

Now, we have to find out the weight of equity which we denote with $WE$, where the  actual value of equity $AE$ is $\$382,500,000$ and the total value of firm $TF$ is $\$558,050,000$

$$\begin{align*}

WE &=\frac{AE}{TF}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{382,500,000}{558,050,000}\\[12pt]
&=0.6854
\end{align*}$$

Therefore, the weight of equity is $\boxed{0.6854}$

Now, we have to find out the weight of preferred stock which we denote with $WP$, where the  actual value of preferred stock $AP$ is $\$25,750,000$ and the total value of firm $TF$ is $\$558,050,000$

$$\begin{align*}

WP &=\frac{AP}{TF}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{25,750,000}{558,050,000}\\[12pt]
&=0.0461
\end{align*}$$

Therefore, the weight of preferred stock is $\boxed{0.0461}$

$b)$ Second, we have to cost of equity which we denote with $CE$, where the t bills yielding $Y$ is $2.4\%$, risk premium $RP$ is $7.5\%$ and the beta $B$ is $1.15$

$$\begin{align*}
CE&=Y + (RP \times B)\\[7pt]
&=2.4\% + (7.5\% \times 1.15)\\[7pt]
&=0.024 + (0.075 \times 1.15)\\[7pt]
&=0.024 +0.086\\[7pt]&=0.11\\[7pt]
&=11\%
\end{align*}$$

So, the cost of equity is $\boxed{11\%}$

We have to find out the yield to maturity of the pre-tax cost of debt by using an excel sheet which we denote with $YTM$, where the number of years $NPER$ is $15$, coupon payment $PMT$ is $51$, par value $PV$ $(1000 \times 1.07)$ is $-1070$ and the face value $FV$ is $1000$

$$\begin{align*}
YTM&=RATE(NPER,PMT,PV,FV)\\[7pt]
&=RATE(15,51,-1070,1000)\\[7pt]
&=4.45\%
\end{align*}$$

So, the yield to maturity of pre- tax debt is $\boxed{4.45\%}$

We have to find out the after tax debt which we denote with $AD$, where the yield to maturity of pre-tax debt $YP$ is $4.45\%$ and the tax rate $TR$ is $22\%$

$$\begin{align*}
AD&=YP \times (1 -TR)\\[7pt]
&=4.45\% \times (1-22\%)\\[7pt]
&=0.0445\times (1-0.22)\\[7pt]
&=0.0445 \times 0.78\\[7pt]
&=0.0347\\[7pt]
&=3.47\%
\end{align*}$$

So, the after tax debt is $\boxed{3.47\%}$

We have to find out the actual cost of preferred stock which we denote with $ACP$, where the outstanding preferred stock $OS$ is $4.2$ and the current selling $CS$ is $\$103$ 

$$\begin{align*}
ACP&=\frac{OS}{CS}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{4.2}{103}\\[12pt]
&=0.0407\\[7pt]
&=4.07\%
\end{align*}$$

So, the actual cost of preferred stock is $\boxed{4.07\%}$

Finally, let's find out the weighted average cost of capital of firm which we denote with $WF$, where the weight of the debt $WD$ is $26.84\%$, after-tax debt $AD$ is $3.47\%$, the weight of equity $WE$ is $68.54\%$, cost of equity $CE$ is $11\%$, the weight of preferred stock $WP$ is $0.0461$ and the actual cost of preferred stock $ACP$ is $4.07\%$ 

$$\begin{align*}
WF&=(WD \times AD) + (WE \times CE)+ (WP \times ACP)\\[7pt]
&=(26.84\% \times 3.47\%) + (68.54\% \times 11\%)+(0.0461 \times 4.07\%)\\[7pt]
&=(0.2684 \times 0.0347) + (0.6854 \times 0.11)+(0.0461 \times 0.0407)\\[7pt]
&=0.0865\\[7pt]
&=8.65\%
\end{align*}$$

Therefore, the weighted average cost of capital of the firm is $\boxed{8.65\%}$
